newsitem.title: EGYPT: Chirac in Cairo on last stop of Mideast peace tour.
newsitem.headline: Chirac in Cairo on last stop of Mideast peace tour.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac arrived in Cairo on Friday on the last stop of a Middle East tour to promote Europe's role in the peace process.
Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak met Chirac, who flew in from Beirut, at Cairo airport. The two leaders will later discuss Chirac's efforts to revive the flagging peace process.
It was the second visit this year for the French president to Egypt, a main political power in the Arab world and host of many rounds of Palestinian-Israel peace talks.
During his week-long tour, Chirac stopped in Syria, Israel, the Palestinian territories, Jordan and Lebanon.
The French leader became an Arab hero after calling for the establishment of a Palestinian state and the return of Arab lands occupied by Israel.
Arabs have been calling for increased European influence in the peace process to balance what they see as the pro-Israeli stand of the United States.
